summary: This is a court order from Judge Alison J. Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell criminal case, addressing the defendant's motions for reconsideration and setting deadlines for government responses. It also provides details about the jury selection process, including timelines for disclosing juror names and conducting peremptory challenges.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (20-CR-330) who has filed motions for reconsideration that are being addressed in this order.

persons.name: Alison J. Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case who issued this order, setting response deadlines and clarifying jury selection procedures.

connections.description: Judge Nathan is presiding over the criminal case against defendant Ghislaine Maxwell and issuing procedural orders.

events.title: Court Order on Motions for Reconsideration
events.description: Judge Alison J. Nathan issues an order addressing Ghislaine Maxwell's motions for reconsideration and sets deadlines for government responses.

events.title: Juror Name Disclosure
events.description: Lawyers will be provided with the names of jurors prior to the commencement of the voir dire process.

events.title: Peremptory Strikes
events.description: The court confirms that peremptory strikes will be exercised on this date, with 40 qualified jurors needed.

locations: United States District Court Southern District of New York
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell filed two motions for reconsideration (Dkt. Nos. 407 and 408) in her criminal case.
The government was ordered to respond to Dkt. No. 408 by November 8, 2021, and to Dkt. No. 407 by November 4, 2021.
Juror names would be disclosed to lawyers on November 16, 2021, before voir dire.
Peremptory challenges were scheduled for November 29, 2021, with the court aiming to qualify 50-60 prospective jurors.
The case is docketed as 20-CR-330 (AJN) in the Southern District of New York.
